HI!: can you suggest me how can I open image files in picasa photo viewer by default instead of gnome image viewer?
open the properties for the file type you want to change, go to the 'open with' section, and change it
there is no option of picasa photo viewer!
no, you have to do it for each file type (.jpg, gif, etc)... just open the properties box for any file of the given type & change it there
for example, put a jpg on your desktop, right click on it, select properties, and change which program opens it... done for all jpg's
give me the command to open that file from picasa cos i dont have that option
under your choices, there's a button marked "Show other applications".. click that
picasa should be in that list

I right click on the png/jpg file then select open with other application, then there is no option for picasa however there is custom command option so i guess there must be a command to open it via picasa can you suggest me that command?
select open with other application is different from opening the properties box, selecting the "open with" tab and clicking the "Show other applications" button
the command would be /path/to/picasa %u ... to find the full path to picasa just type "which picasa"
